data.title: Something to Experience
data.text: I cannot even begin to describe how much I loved the atmosphere of this place. A few awesome highlights include a room dedicated to unique soda pop, they deliver your check in a children's book, really friendly and prompt service, and the food- it is just great! I enjoyed their black bean burger, and their french fries were divine. I would recommend this place to anyone.

data.title: Interesting surroundings, okay food
data.text: I really liked the feel of this restaurant, and my overall memory of it is quite positive even though the food was average.  We got in around 6 pm and therefore only waited 20 minutes to get a table, but in the 20 minutes of waiting, the wait time went up to an hour, so it seems that getting there early makes a difference.  The menu has pages of sodas and one full page of only Root Beer.  I had the Black Bean burger.  It was more bun than burger.  It was good, but very thin.  I would have liked a thicker one.  The bun was very thick.  My son had the Alamo burger and liked it a lot.

data.title: Love this place.
data.text: Okay, so it's a sit down restaurant and it is never super fast. But, that's okay. It's not supposed to be and the food is totally worth it. I love getting the chicken sandwich. And the fried cookie dough is INCREDIBLE. This is a place I always take anyone visiting.

data.title: Popular with Average Food
data.text: Interesting restaurant with unusual decor. They are big on sodas, which you must try even though they are loaded with sugar. We were under the impression they were made and bottled here, but not sure. My chicken salad sandwich was good, but not great. It was too thick to eat with the bun, so I would redesign this item and skip the bun. The fries were really good. My wife had the shrimp Caesar which she did not finish. Half way through our meal, our waiter asked if we wanted desert. Huh? When we said no, he brought our bill - obviously to make room for the next group. Would try somewhere else next time.

data.title: Chill environ - great food - good service
data.text: Get the chicken & waffles, you will not be disappointed. Great selection of tasty sodas. Lots of other good choices. No one of our group was disappointed. All good stuff.

data.title: Sub-par
data.text: Maybe I went on an off night but my wife and I weren't impressed at all. She ordered their tomato soup and it was more like marinara sauce. Good reviews but we won't be going back.

data.title: Hidden Gem in Downtown Provo
data.text: Headed there on a whim -- and fell in love. The Chicken-and-Waffles was fabulous, and the burger that also has pork on it was divine -- but the best was their Home-Brew Bottomless Rootbeer. A new favorite!

data.title: Great Character
data.text: We went to this restaurant to celebrate our anniversary from a referral of a friend of ours. We were greeted by a friendly wait staff and our service was awesome. They have a great selection of specialty sodas. The menu was loaded with great options, if you like american food, there will be something for you here. Must stop by and experience station 22.

data.title: Service Slow, Food Average
data.text: We had heard good things about this restaurant but we were very disappointed.  We came on a Friday about 2pm for lunch.  We waited about 25 minutes for a table even though we could see 5 empty tables.  Once seated it took about 10 minutes to get some drinks and 45 minutes to get our food.  We ordered Freedom Dip, burger and chicken sandwich.  The only thing we all liked was the sweet potato wedges(which were extra with our meal).  They have root beer on tap and a soda bar (see pictures).  I guess they are known for their Southern dishes but no one told us before we ordered.  Won't be back.

data.title: Loved the burger, but huge mac and cheese
data.text: If you order the mac and cheese expect to take some home or share. It tastes great! I had the burger with the brie cheese and bourbon sauce with sweet potatoes loke 12$ and a house rootbeer but the wife had a virgils rotbeer, $4.50 so we loved the meal. The deserts however were dry. We had both cakes, the raspberry chocolate for the first and the blue berry lemon for the second.  The fried cookie dough was just ok too. But combine the cinnamon ice cream with the dry cake and then its ok but not that I would order them again.

data.title: Large burger and great cream soda
data.text: I ordered a fairly classic burger and was extremely satisfied with the large patty and great taste. I'm not into really unique burgers, but this had enough of a taste to make it different, but still delicious. I loved the cream soda I ordered (in a glass bottle!) and the fries were yummy! On top of that, the waitress was fun and helpful and the atmosphere was cozy and welcoming! Loved it and definitely want to go back.

data.title: Cold Food
data.text: Paid $12 for cold Mac n cheese. The cheese that didn't melt was still cold from the refrigerator and the noodles were cold. Very disappointing.

data.title: Awesome Place In Downtown Provo!
data.text: This new restaurant is a great addition to Downtown Provo. Located right across from the Provo Temple with patio seating to enjoy the sites and sounds of downtown. I had the chicken and waffles and they were delicious. Chicken had a great crispy taste and the sauce balanced with sweetness. I highly recommend this place when in Provo.

data.title: Yummy!
data.text:
My son and I stopped by for a mid afternoon snack. We shared the chicken and waffles with a side of fries; I am not one for fried food so this was a sinful treat. The fries had some sort of batter or coating and were absolutely delicious. 
The waffle was tasty and the chicken moist. All in all, a good experience with great service. 
I would definitely go back!

data.title: Excellent food! Wish they would take reservations..
data.text: My son requested eating at Station 22 for his birthday, and that was the first time we'd ever eaten there. The food was so delicious! The only drawback is that they do not take reservations. We were there on a Thursday, late afternoon in March, and we still waited for 45 min. We will definitely go back and highly recommend it!...just plan in the wait time and visit a few of the cool stores on Center St.

data.title: Worth the wait
data.text: Our first time at Station 22 was amazing! We ordered the Po boy and Whiskey Chicken, along with some sweet potato wedges. We loved our first experience we decided to go back soon after. The second time was sadly not as good, but we're definitely not giving up. We had waffle chicken and golden state burger, we also got the deep fried cookie dough for dessert. I was very disappointed that we had to wait nearly 30 minutes for charred cookie dough. I was surprised we were served something not edible. I would rate our first visit a 5 and our second visit a 3.

data.title: Great Whiskey Chicken!
data.text: I have eaten here a few times and the food is always good.  The last time I ate here I had the Whiskey Chicken and it was amazing.  I would highly recommend it.  I have also had the Chicken and Waffles.  If you happen to be in downtown Provo this place is definitely worth the visit.

owner_response.author: Richard G, Owner at Station 22, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the review, Alan; please come again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Don't miss your station stop
data.text: I've been here quite a few times but it'd been a while since i'd been last and when I went for lunch the other day I was reminded how good the food is and why I don't go as often. The food is great and I'm rarely disappointed with my choices.  My only complaint is that its a bit expensive.

owner_response.author: Richard G, Owner at Station 22, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for your review. You're welcome to come as often as you like!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: VERY UNIQUE FOOD AND BEVERAGE CHOICES AS WELL AS UNIQUE ATMOSPHERE
data.text: We eat out in Provo about once a month because our son goes to school there.  We live about 1 1/2 hour away and drive down to visit and eat.  We love to try new restaurants each visit.  We loved Station 22.  It's a small restaurant on  Center Street and very easy to get to. We went at lunchtime and had a small wait but it was so fun to see what everyone else was ordering.  They have a wide variety of burgers, sandwiches, seafood baskets, delicious beer battered fries with a delicious sauce for dipping and a HUGE selection of originally crafted sodas.   Our son had the Golden State Burger.  I had the 22 Club Sandwich on Ciabatta Bread.  My husband got the Honest Abe Burger.  So DELICIOUS.  It was  a great choice.  I would definitely go there again.  Mid price range.  We were very happy we tried it.

data.title: Burger was good Shrimp dish not so much....
data.text: The craft soda selection is very good as folks say.  We stopped in for dinner and had to wait about an hour to be seated (so the place was definitely in demand).  My husband ordered a burger which was quite good.  My son and I ordered a shrimp special with grit cakes and a sauce.  The grit cakes were good.  The sauce was interesting... sort of a hot/sweet/sour sauce.  The sauce was not bad persay but I would not seek it out again.  Unfortunately my plate was literally swimming in the sauce.  Swimming as in when the waiter put down the plate the sauce was in danger of slopping off my plate.  It really looked like I ordered soup with some shrimp on top.  For us the service was also very slow - we had to keep flagging our waiter down.  I would not go out of my way to come back here but if I did go back I would definitely get a burger instead.
